metadata.title: CVE-2016-3597 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox component in OracleVirtualization VirtualBox before 5.0.26 allows local users to affectavailability via vectors related to Core.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3597` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 5.0.26
virtualbox-dkms - 5.0.26
virtualbox-guest-dkms - 5.0.26
virtualbox-guest-source - 5.0.26
virtualbox-guest-utils - 5.0.26
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 5.0.26
virtualbox-qt - 5.0.26
virtualbox-source - 5.0.26
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.26').
